StatsContent.enSavoirPlus: <0>Learn moreThis</0>section is generated from visits over the last 60 days. Visits with a time spent on the site of less than 1 minute have been discarded. To avoid the iframe bias that can generate inactive visitors in the statistics, the average time on the site has been calculated from active visits (the user has clicked on "Take the test").

about.description: This simulator allows you to evaluate your total annual individual carbon footprint and by major categories (food, transportation, housing, miscellaneous, utilities, digital), to situate it in relation to the climate objectives and above all to take action at your level with personalized gestures according to your answers.

accessibility.description: The site Our Climate Gestures is partially compliant with the General Accessibility Guidelines, RGAA version 4.1

actions.description: Find out how you can reduce your climate footprint

Contribution.description: Find out the most common questions about Our Climate Action, and how to ask new ones or help us.

actionslide.description: Top 3 actions to reduce my climate footprint by {{roundedValue}} tons of CO‚ÇÇ‚Çë.

Petrogaz.description: My oil footprint is {{footprint}} full of oil. Measure yours!

Landing.description: Test your carbon footprint, alone or in a group. Discover the breakdown of your footprint. Follow the path to action to reduce it.

Diffuser.description: This simulator allows you to evaluate your total annual individual carbon footprint and by major categories (food, transportation, housing, miscellaneous, utilities, digital), to situate it in relation to the climate objectives and above all to take action at your level with personalized gestures according to your answers.

Documentation.description: Our calculation model is completely transparent. Everyone can explore it, give their opinion, improve it.

Privacy.description: Our climate gestures, out of group mode, work without a server, so your data stays with you. We collect anonymously aggregated data to improve the simulator.

Conference.donn√©esExplications: <0>By participating, you agree to share your aggregated simulation results with other conference participants: the total and the categories (transportation, housing, etc.). However, our servers do not store them: it works in P2P (peer to peer).</0><1>Only the name of the conference room will be indexed in <2>the usage statistics</2> of Our Climate Action. </1>

DataWarning.viePriv√©e: {emoji('üïµ')} By participating, you agree to the <3>anonymous</3> collection of your aggregated simulation results on our server: total climate footprint and categories (transportation, housing, etc.). <6>Read more</6>

Instructions.avertissementModeConference: Your organization may block the use of the conference mode. Test this beforehand with a duet: if there is a problem, you can use the polling mode.
Instructions.contextualisationLink: Want to add questions to get additional information about respondents? <2>Check out the "survey contextualization!" feature. </2>
Instructions.descriptionModeConference: Ephemeral mode: perfect for a workshop, an interactive presentation or between friends. The data remains between the participants (peer-to-peer), without a server, <2>just for the time of the conference</2>.
Instructions.descriptionModeSondage: Persistent mode: the interface is almost the same, but the data is stored on our server and thus remains accessible <1>for two months</1>.
Instructions.guideLien: The results are in, what to do? Our guide accompanies you in your thoughts and discussions on this page
Instructions.intro: <0>The climate footprint test is an individual test, but here we suggest that you do it with others. Everyone will be behind his or her own screen, but will be able to see the results of the others in real time.</0><1>It is an opportunity to confront others and to think together about the stakes of our own impact.</1>
Instructions.liensSimulationConference: At the agreed time, open this link all at the same time and do your own simulation.
Instructions.liensSimulationSondage: Participants must come to make their simulation on this link.
Instructions.resultatInfos: The results for each category (food, transportation, housing, etc.) are displayed progressively and in real time for the entire group on

NamingBlock.nomSalleCourt: Your room name is short, there is a small risk that strangers can guess it
NamingBlock.nomSalleDoitContenirDesLettres: Your room name can only contain letters, numbers and dashes

NoTestMessage.bienvenue: Welcome to the group mode of Our Climate Action! You haven't started your test yet, go ahead!

Survey.csv: You can retrieve the survey results in .csv format.
Survey.excel: To open it with Microsoft Excel, open an empty spreadsheet, then Data > From a text / CSV file. Select "Origin: Unicode UTF-8" and "Delimiter: comma".
Survey.libreOffice: To open it with <2>LibreOffice</2>, it is automatic.
Survey.resultat: The results on the view page only include participants who completed <1>at least 10% of the test</1>. The CSV, on the other hand, contains the simulations of all the people who participated in the survey by clicking on the link. The "progress" column allows you to filter the simulations in turn.

Contribution.description: Here you will find answers to the most frequently asked questions. If you still have questions or if you want to suggest improvements, go to the bottom of the page. Have a good read!

ActionTeaser.f√©licitations: {{displayedTotal}} tons!<2> You are well below the French average.</2>
ActionTeaser.messagePourConvaincre: Chances are, your time will be better spent convincing and helping others than trying to earn your "extra tons" (although you will have to do that eventually).

IframeDataShareModal.text: <0>By clicking on the Accept button, you authorize {{parent}} to retrieve your climate footprint.</0><1>It is your results on the main categories (transport, food...), but <1>not</1> the detail question by question (your km by car, the m¬≤ of your home...).</1><2>Nosgestesclimat.fr is not affiliated with the site {{parent}}.</2>

Petrogaz.explications: <0>It is a <1>minimum</1> estimate of your crude oil consumption for the year.</0><1>Estimated via your car, plane, bus and heating oil consumption, it does not (yet) take into account the oil used to transport your purchases, and the grey energy of your various possessions.</1>

Personas.description: Personas will allow us to take the side of a diversity of users when they see our "take action" screen.
Personas.lienGenerateur: For the first names, you can use <2>this generator</2>
Personas.tuto: that it happens. You can either copy and paste data from another persona and modify it, or create one from scratch from the simulation. Once the simulation is satisfactory, click on "Modify my answers" then type Ctrl-C, open the browser console (F12), make sure you are in the "Console" tab, go to the very bottom of the console (it is a bit busy...), then copy the JSON displayed, paste it into <2>this tool</2> to generate a YAML, then insert it into personas.yaml.

Profil.locationDonn√©es: <0>Where is my data? </0>Your data is stored in your browser, so you have full control over it. <2></2>
Profil.recap: You have answered {{answeredQuestionsLength}} questions and chosen {{actionChoicesLength}} actions.

SimulationMissing.personnas: You can also see the action path as if you were one of these typical profiles.
SimulationMissing.simulationManquante: You haven't taken the test yet. To unlock this path, you need to tell us a little more about your lifestyle.

Tutorial.slide1: <0>Don't panic, we explain what it is.</0><1>The planet is <1>warming up dangerously</1>, as we emit more and more greenhouse gases.</1>

slide2.blockquote: Other gases, especially methane <1></1> and nitrous oxide <5></5> also warm the planet: we convert their warming potential to CO‚ÇÇ equivalent to simplify the measurement.
slide2.p1: With a unit with a barbaric name: the CO‚ÇÇ equivalent. Carbon dioxide<1></1>, you know it: we breathe it out all day, but without influence on the climate.
slide2.p2: It is the machines that make our modern comfort that reject massively, so much so that it is counted in thousands of kilos per year and per person, therefore in <1>tons</1> of CO‚ÇÇe!

slide3.p1: Each year, a French person emits on average <2> about 10 tons</2> of CO‚ÇÇe.
slide3.p2: This is your starting point in this test: each of your answers will personalize this result in the score bar.

slide4.blockquote: {{ emoji1 }} New ! See also your oil consumption {{emoji2 }}, a complementary indicator to the climate topic.
slide4.p1: <0>And the goal?</0><1>We have to decrease our climate footprint as soon as possible.</1><2>In France, this means going from ~10 tons to <2>less than 2 tons</2> per year.</2>

Tutorial.slide5: <0>Where does our footprint come from?</0><1>Taking the car, eating a steak, heating your house, getting medical care, buying a TV...</1><2><0></0></2><3>The footprint of our individual consumption is the sum of all these activities that make up our modern life. </3>
Tutorial.slide6: <0>So, are you ready to go?</0><1>A few tips to help you complete the test.</1><2>üë§ Answer the questions on behalf of yourself, not your household: this is an individual test.</2><3>üíº Answer for your personal life, not for your job or studies. <3>One exception: </3> your commute must be included in the miles driven.</3><4>‚ùìÔ∏è Any other questions? Check out our <3>FAQs</3> at any time.</4>
